title: Caustic Ingestion Injury
diagnosis_topic: Chemical injury to the esophagus and stomach after ingestion of corrosive agents
setup_script: A 25-year-old woman ingested an unknown quantity of drain cleaner in a suicide attempt. She has odynophagia and drooling upon arrival.

dynamic_flow.reply: Stridor and hoarseness present; prepare for early intubation to secure airway before edema progresses.
BP 115/75 mmHg, HR 105 bpm, RR 24/min, Temp 37.1 C.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident avoids inducing emesis or inserting NG tube blindly
dynamic_flow.reply: Prevent further injury to the esophagus and stomach.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident establishes IV access, keeps patient NPO and administers IV fluids
If resident orders chest and abdominal X-ray
dynamic_flow.reply: No free air suggesting perforation; consider CT scan if perforation suspected.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident arranges endoscopy within 12-24 hours
dynamic_flow.reply: Evaluates extent of injury using Zargar classification; avoids endoscopy if airway unstable or suspicion of perforation.
Supportive care with IV PPI, sucralfate and gradual advancement of diet; steroids controversial and not routinely recommended.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If injury is grade III or perforation present
dynamic_flow.reply: Surgical intervention with esophagectomy or gastrectomy and mediastinal drainage; broad-spectrum antibiotics started.
Assess suicide risk and arrange mental health support.
Risk of sudden airway compromise due to edema increases.
Monitor for esophageal strictures requiring dilation and increased risk of squamous cell carcinoma; regular surveillance endoscopy recommended.
Importance of safe storage of caustic substances and awareness of poisoning hotline resources.

critical_decision_points: Immediate airway assessment and avoidance of inducing emesis in caustic ingestion
Early endoscopic evaluation to grade mucosal injury
Supportive care for minor burns and surgical intervention for deep or perforated injuries
Need for psychiatric evaluation and family education on prevention
Long-term surveillance for strictures and malignancy
